result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan R. Howe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay court costs, child porn surcharges of $500 and DNA surcharges of $250 for each count. Pay all financial obligation at least 90 days prior release.   If is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment /Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

No contact with minors without Agent's approval.
Not to view any pornographic images of children.
Not to use chat rooms unless pre-approved by Agent.

Any personal internet usage to be determined and/or approved by the Agent in advanced, may be able to use for work and education purposes only.
Comply with sexual Offender Registry.
Comply with sex offender treatment recommendations.
Comply with any recommended psychological treatment, including taking any medication as prescribed by a physician.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment, and programing as recommended by the Compas assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
Sign releases of information for offender's assessments, forms, medications/pharmacy(s) prescriptions and/or treatment.
Use one pharmacy for prescription(s).
Agent can determine if appropriate or not, if appropriate Defendant may participate in the Milwaukee Teen Challenge program during extended supervision.
Provide DNA for testing if not already completed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing on 06-16-16

2:32 p.m. Defendant Morgan R. Howe in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report. No corrections needed. DA Molepske makes sentencing recommendations to the Court for a total of 6 yrs IN and 10 yrs ES w/conditions.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing recommendations of a total of 3 yrs In and 6 yrs ES, concurrent counts and Teen program. 367 days credit.
Defendant makes statements. 
Court makes statements.

***BY THE COURT***PRISON***
Count 1: 50 months Incarceration + 50 months Extended Supervision for each counts
same for 2 thru 5, concurrent

Conditions:
No contact with minors without Agent's approval.
Any personal internet usage to be determined and/or approved by the Agent in advanced, may be able to use for work and education purposes only.
Not to view any pornographic images of children.
Not to use chat rooms unless pre-approved by Agent.
Comply with sexual Offender Registry.
Undergo a  Mental health assessment.
Comply with sex offender treatment recommendations.
Comply with any recommended psychological treatment, including taking any medication as prescribed by a physician.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment, and programing as recommended by the Compas assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
Sign releases of information for offender's assessments, forms, medications/pharmacy(s) prescriptions and/or treatment.
Use one pharmacy for prescription(s).
Agent can determine if appropriate or not, if appropriate Defendant may participate in the Milwaukee Teen Challenge program during extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Provide DNA for testing if not already completed.
Pay court costs, porn surcharges $500 and $250 DNA surcharges for each count. Pay all financial obligation at least 90 days prior release
Credit of 367 days credit.

Appeal rights provided
Sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
copies sent to DA & Atty(kp)
Sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Morgan R. Howe in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Morgan R. Howe in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:25 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Drengler enters a plea of NO CONTEST.

Defendant will enter pleas to Count 1 through Count 5. Count 6 through Count 10 will be dismissed and read in.
State makes recommendation: Ct 1 - 8 yrs prison; Ct 2 - 8 yrs prison consecutive to Ct 1; Ct 3 - 8 yrs prison concurrent; Ct 4 - 8 yrs prison concurrent and Ct 5 - 8 yrs prison concurrent. Parties will be requesting a PSI and Defense is free to argue.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 through Count 5

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
There are no repeater allegations.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 through Count 5: Found Guilty
Count 6 through Count 10: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.

Parties be given not less than 10 days following receipt of copy of PSI to review it, evaluate it before sentencing.
Parties are to set date for sentencing with Judicial Assistant.

State requests bond be revoked.
Defense will reserve any argument.

BY THE COURT:
For the time being, Court will revoke bond.
Plea hearing at 03-11-2016 09:00 am
Notice and State's Response to the Defendant's Motion for the Court to Pre-Determine Whether Wis. Stat. 929.617 Requires a Minimum Period of Incarceration for Possession of Child Pornography
Pre-trial conference at 12-14-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Morgan R. Howe in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Morgan R. Howe in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:34 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

This is Atty Drengler's motion whether or not there is a minimum period of incarceration.

Court has read the motion and brief of both parties.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court regarding the statute referred to, mandatory minimum would not apply to Defendant.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding the statute referred to.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the motion.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding clarifying the minimum sentence. 

PTC will be set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing at 11-18-2015 10:30 am

Notice and State's Response to Defendant's Motion for the Court to Pre-Determine Whether Wis. Stat. 939.617 Requires a Minimum Period of Incarceration for Possession of Child Pornography and Memorandum of Law
for the Court to make a Determination Whether Wis. Stat. 939.617 Requires a Minimum Period of Incarceration and Memorandum of Law

ADDRESS INFO for Morgan R. Howe
Current: B3741 River Ave, Spencer, WI 54479-9399 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 325 Soo Marie Avenue #7, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Status conference at 11-16-2015 08:30 am
Status conference at 10-05-2015 09:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 08-17-2015 09:00 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Defendant Morgan R. Howe in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Morgan R. Howe in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Louis Molepske, Jr.

3:18 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 07-06-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Morgan R. Howe appeared by video. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
/s/ JVF 06/15/15 - Morgan Howe residence @ 325 Soo Marie Ave., Apt 7, Stevens Point, WI  54481 and Computer Tower, Dell Laptop and Asus Laptop

Submit to photographs and fingerprinting by the agency or to the law enforcement agency named in the criminal complaint.                   
Not to possess any item that would grant him access to the internet including computers, phone or any other devices.
Not to have internet access on devices that would allow him access to the internet.
Not to gain access to the internet. 
No direct/indirect contact with minor children unless they are supervised by adults at the time of the contact.

DA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Child Pornography.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

State requests a $8,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement, if he choses to make a statement, anything he says could potentionally be used against him in the future. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court re: having spoken to a public defender. 
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   6/29/15 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
